data.title: Morgan Hill, California Population History
data.meta_description: Access the most recent census population information for Morgan Hill, California, including a population profile and history.
data.text:
Morgan Hill Population Facts

What is the current population of Morgan Hill?

Based on the latest 2024 data from the US census, the current population of Morgan Hill is 44,478. Morgan Hill, California is the 905th largest city in the US.

What county is Morgan Hill, California in?

Morgan Hill is located entirely in Santa Clara County.

What is the size of Morgan Hill, California in square miles?

Morgan Hill has an area of 12.9 square miles.

What was the peak population of Morgan Hill?

The peak population of Morgan Hill was in 2020, when its population was 45,551. In 2020, Morgan Hill was the 870th largest city in the US; now its fallen to the 905th largest city in the US. Morgan Hill is currently 2.4% smaller than it was in 2020.

How quickly is Morgan Hill growing?

Morgan Hill has grown 30.2% since the 2000. Morgan Hill, California is growing somewhat quickly; it is growing faster than 70% of similarly sized cities since 2000.

What is the population density of Morgan Hill, California?

Morgan Hill has a population density of 2,940.7 people per square mile.

Morgan Hill Demographics

What is the voting age population of Morgan Hill, California?

The total voting age population of Morgan Hill, California, meaning US citizens 18 or older, is 30,113. The voting age population is 48.8% male and 51.2% female.

What percentage of Morgan Hill, California residents are senior citizens?

According to the latest census statistics, 14.0% of the residents of Morgan Hill are 65 or older.

What are the racial demographics of Morgan Hill, California?

The racial demographics of Morgan Hill are 73.0% White, 14.0% Asian, 6.3% Two or more races, 4.3% Other, 1.9% Black, 0.4% American Indian and 0.1% Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander. Additionally, 31.3% of the population identifies as Hispanic.

What percentage of Morgan Hill, California residents are below the poverty line?

In Morgan Hill, 4.7% of residents have an income below the poverty line, and the child poverty rate is 6.4%. On a per-household basis, 3.1% of families are below the poverty line in Morgan Hill.

What percentage of Morgan Hill, California residents are in the labor force?

Among those aged 16 and older, 67.4% of Morgan Hill residents are in the labor force.

What are the education levels among Morgan Hill, California residents?

Among the adult population 25 years old and over, 92.2% of Morgan Hill residents have at least a high school degree or equivalent, 43.9% have a bachelor's degree and 15.2% have a graduate or professional degree.

What percentage of Morgan Hill, California residents speak a non-English language at home?

Among Morgan Hill residents aged 5 and older, 27.9% of them speak a non-English language at home. Broken down by language: 15.3% of residents speak Spanish at home, 3.7% speak an Indo-European language, and 7.9% speak an Asian language.

Morgan Hill Income & Labor Statistics

What is the unemployment rate in Morgan Hill, California?

The unemployment rate in Morgan Hill is 4.0%, which is calculated among residents aged 16 or older who are in the labor force.

What percentage of Morgan Hill, California residents work for the government?

In Morgan Hill, 13.4% of the residents in the non-military labor force are employed by the local, state and federal government.

What is the median income in Morgan Hill, California?

The median household income in Morgan Hill is $124,419.

Morgan Hill Housing & Rent Statistics

What percentage of housing units are owner-occupied in Morgan Hill, California?

In Morgan Hill, 73.9% of housing units are occupied by their owners.

What percentage of housing units are rented in Morgan Hill, California?

Renters occupy 26.1% of housing units in Morgan Hill.

What percentage of Morgan Hill, California housing units were built before 1940?

Of all the housing units in Morgan Hill, 1.7% of them were build before 1940.

What percentage of Morgan Hill, California housing units were built after 2000?

In Morgan Hill, 26.4% of the total housing units were built after the year 2000, which is approximately 4,000 units.

What is the median monthly rent in Morgan Hill, California?

The median gross monthly rent payment for renters in Morgan Hill is $1,763.

What percentage of households in Morgan Hill, California have broadband internet?

In Morgan Hill, 92.0% of households have an active broadband internet connection.
